poem:
A Festive Contrast

In the quiet of winter,  
cherries afloat in spirit,  
a nod to tradition's sweet embrace,  
yet here stands chocolate—  
dark and silent,  
consoling the weary heart.  
Beyond sugared fruit's indulgence,  
its velvet touch  
speaks of warmth,  
a whisper against the cold,  
a solace beyond the festal din,  
chiming softly in the night.
